intro: Neocollettia, commonly known as the false orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique, often showy inflorescences and are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Neocollettia species typically have slender, erect stems and are often epiphytic or lithophytic, growing on trees or rocks. Their flowers are usually small to medium in size and come in a variety of colors, including white, yellow, and red. The genus is notable for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and its role in ornamental horticulture.
